name: brne0
params: class c0, class c1, class c2

stmt.origin: sylbi(wbr(c0, c1, c2), wne(c1, emptycls), wcel(cop(c0, c2), c1))

body.origin:
|- wi(wbr(c0, c1, c2), wne(c1, emptycls))
-| wb(wbr(c0, c1, c2), wcel(cop(c0, c2), c1))
-| wi(wcel(cop(c0, c2), c1), wne(c1, emptycls))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wbr(c0, c1, c2), wne(c1, emptycls))
-| wb(wbr(c0, c1, c2), wcel(cop(c0, c2), c1))
-| wi(wcel(cop(c0, c2), c1), wne(c1, emptycls))

body.origin: |- wb(wbr(c0, c1, c2), wcel(cop(c0, c2), c1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wbr(c0, c1, c2), wne(c1, emptycls))
-| wi(wcel(cop(c0, c2), c1), wne(c1, emptycls))

comment: If two sets are in a binary relation, the relation cannot be empty. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 7-Jul-2018.)
